UnderlyingAssetType.title: Underlying Asset Type

OptionExerciseStyle.title: Option Exercise Style
OptionExerciseStyle.description: Indicates when the option can be exercised. A Bermudan option can be exercised only on predetermined date; American option can be exercised at anytime prior to and including its expiry date; A European option can only be exercised at the expiry date

elaboration.AMER: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to buy (call) or sell (put) specified assets (product) at a fixed price at any time during the term of the put option, up to and including the expiration date of the contract
elaboration.BERM: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to buy (call) or sell (put) specified assets (product) at a fixed price on a number of specific dates within the exercise period of the contract
elaboration.EURO: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to buy (call) or sell (put) specified assets (product) at a fixed price, only on the contract's expiration date

OptionType.title: Option Type
OptionType.description: Indication as to whether the derivative contract is a call (right to purchase a specific underlying asset) or a put (right to sell a specific underlying asset) or whether it is a chooser (right to decide whether it is a call or put prior to the expiration date)

elaboration.CALL: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to buy specified assets (product)
elaboration.PUTO: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to sell specified assets (product)
elaboration.OPTL: An option on a contract which allows its holder (buyer) to exercise the right to buy (call) or sell (put) specified assets (product); The buyer does not have to decide whether the contract will be a put or a call until an agreed future date, prior to expiration

ValuationMethodorTrigger.title: Valuation Method or Trigger
ValuationMethodorTrigger.description: The Valuation method or trigger as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.Vanilla: an option for which all terms are standardized
elaboration.Asian: an option where either the strike price or the settlement price is the average level of an underlying instrument over a predetermined period; the averaging can be either a geometric or arithmetic average
elaboration.Digital (Binary): an option that has a pre-determined payout if the option is in-the-money and the payoff condition is satisfied; also referred to as a "binary option" or an "all-or-nothing option"
elaboration.Barrier: an option whose final exercise depends upon the path taken by the price of an underlying instrument; for a knockout barrier option, the option is cancelled if the underlying price crosses a predetermined barrier level; for a knock-in barrier option, the option becomes available-for-exercise if the underlying price crosses a predetermined barrier level
elaboration.Digital Barrier: a digital option embedded with a barrier option; there are different variations of this type of option; as an example, a down-and-out digital call option will pay a fixed payoff, or the underlying, at any time before maturity that the underlying price is equal to or greater than the barrier level; it will pay zero if the underlying price is less than the barrier level
elaboration.Lookback: an option that minimizes the uncertainties related to the timing of market entry; there are two types of lookback options: fixed and floating; the fixed option strike is determined at purchase, and the floating option strike is determined at maturity
elaboration.Other Path Dependent: an option on a contract whose payoff is directly related to the price pattern the underlying asset follows during the life of the contract

DeliveryType.title: Delivery Type
DeliveryType.description: The Delivery Type as defined by CFI code: ISO 10962 (2015)

elaboration.CASH: the discharge of an obligation by payment or receipt of a net cash amount instead of payment or delivery by both parties
elaboration.PHYS: the meeting of a settlement obligation under a derivative contract through the receipt or delivery of the actual underlying instrument(s) instead of through cash settlement
elaboration.OPTL: the method of delivery of the underlying instrument when the option is exercised shall be determined at the time of exercise
